item.title: Social Media Page
item.content: Highlight customers using your services who share about it on social media here with an instagram feed! Make an introduction here and embed your feed below.

item.title: Thank You
item.content: We will be sending you awesome stories once a month.

item.title: Testimonials
item.description: Having served the San Diego area for a number of years, I've seen hundreds of clients. Here are a few of their stories.

item.name: Rachelle Duckworth, Master Lash Artist
item.title: @rduckworth
item.description:
Danielle is seriously a lash guru!


I was feeling extremely discouraged, and ready to give up on lashing. Then I met Danielle and had the opportunity to participate in her training program. She changed everything by providing the right tools and sharing her expert knowledge.


Before participating in Danielle’s training program, I had been ‘certified’ through a larger brand. The training was short, and expensive. The product was difficult to work with leaving me constantly frustrated that my results were not up to par. After months of practice I still didn’t feel ready to take clients.


A friend of mine knew of the frustrations I was having while trying to get my lashing career started and put me in contact with Danielle. After talking to her I knew right away that I wanted to participate in her training program. She is very knowledgeable and passionate about what she does, and it really shows in her work. Her hands on approach and lashing techniques are so valuable.

Upon completing Danielle’s training I couldn’t wait to get out there and start lashing! I now have the proper set of skills to feel confident and am getting results that I am proud of. I highly encourage anyone that is interested in becoming a lash artist, or a lash artist that is feeling discouraged, to participate in this program! Best decision ever!

-Happy Lash Artist (Rachelle D)

item.name: Rachel Doty, Expert Lash Artist
item.title: @racheydoty
item.description:
“Hi my name is Rachel! I was trained through an outside lash company and I was so lost and confused- the things they taught me were only slowing me down more.
Danielle and Amanda re-trained me and completely changed my lash life! They were so amazing, sweet, patient, and helpful. In one day, with the tips and tricks, amazing product, time they spent visually showing me, watching me, and answering my questions thoroughly, I went from a struggling lash artist who could barely do a full set in 4 hours with only 30 lashes on each eye to a confident lash artist who can now deliver beautiful, full, lashes on every single lash in half the time. I’m forever thankful for Danielle and Amanda! Now I finally feel I’m ready to shine as an eyelash specialist.”

item.name: Tifany, Expert Lash Artist
item.title: @s3ren3
item.description: Eyelash extension artist•product junkie•esthetician•artist•jewelry designer•DIY lover•comic lover•sailor moon lover•90's lover•cat lover•no h8• â™¡

item.link_title: Full Set of Classic Lash Extensions
item.name: Full Set of Classic Lash Extensions
item.description: Classic eyelash extensions are when one extension is adhered to every single eyelash. A full set is a 2 hour long appointment wherein I make sure every lash has an extension!

item.title: Flavour Or Powdered
item.short_blurb: The cayenne pepper—also known as the Guinea spice,[1] cow-horn pepper, aleva, bird pepper,[2] or, especially in its powdered form, red pepper—is a hot chili pepper used to flavour dishesIt is red colored when ripened to maturity, but also eaten while still green It is a cultivar of Capsicum annuum related to bell peppers, jalapeños, paprika and othersThe Capsicum genus is in the nightshade family (Solanaceae)

item.title: Generally 30000 At
item.embed: The cayenne pepper—also known as the Guinea spice,[1] cow-horn pepper, aleva, bird pepper,[2] or, especially in its powdered form, red pepper—is a hot chili pepper used to flavour dishesIt is red colored when ripened to maturity, but also eaten while still green It is a cultivar of Capsicum annuum related to bell peppers, jalapeños, paprika and othersThe Capsicum genus is in the nightshade family (Solanaceae)
item.content:
Cayenne is used in cooking spicy dishes, as a powder or in its whole form (such as in Korean, Sichuan and other Asian cuisine), or in a thin, vinegar-based sauce

It is also used as an herbal supplement, and was mentioned by Nicholas Culpeper in his Complete Herbal, 1653, as 'guinea pepper'[3] a misnomer for 'guiana pepper'

  • Powdered To
  • Chili Cayenne
  • Pepper,[2] Spice,[1]
  • Pepper, In
